titleStmt.title: The gowlin: or, a pleasant fancy for the spring Being a brisk encounter betwixt a Scotch leard, and a buxome begger-wene he captivated was at the first sight, not with her gay attire, but beauty bright: he woo'd and won her for to serve his will, yet he's a leard, and she a begger still. To a new play-house tune: or, See the gowlin my Jo, &c. With allowance.
titleStmt.author: D'Urfey, Thomas, 1653-1723.

titleStmt.title: The gowlin: or, a pleasant fancy for the spring Being a brisk encounter betwixt a Scotch leard, and a buxome begger-wene he captivated was at the first sight, not with her gay attire, but beauty bright: he woo'd and won her for to serve his will, yet he's a leard, and she a begger still. To a new play-house tune: or, See the gowlin my Jo, &c. With allowance.
titleStmt.author: D'Urfey, Thomas, 1653-1723.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for F. Coles, T. Vere, J. Wright, and J. Clarke,

notesStmt.note: Place and date of publication from Wing CD-ROM, which gives a range of dates: 1681-1684.
In four columns each headed with an illustration.
Reproduction of the original in the Bodleian Library (reel 1810:4) and Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library (2952:3).
